title: Level 10 Space Practice Test
description: Test your understanding of circle theorems, geometric proofs, vectors, and transformations.

questions.question: The angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is $120°$. What is the angle at the circumference subtended by the same arc?
questions.explanation: The angle at the centre is twice the angle at the circumference. So the circumference angle $= \frac{120°}{2} = 60°$.

questions.question: $AB$ is a diameter of a circle. $C$ is a point on the circumference. What is $\angle ACB$?
questions.explanation: An angle in a semicircle (subtended by a diameter) is always $90°$. This is true regardless of where $C$ is on the circumference.

questions.question: In a cyclic quadrilateral, one angle is $72°$. What is the opposite angle?
questions.explanation: Opposite angles of a cyclic quadrilateral are supplementary: $180° - 72° = 108°$.

questions.question: A point $(3, 5)$ is reflected in the x-axis. What are the new coordinates?
questions.explanation: Reflection in the x-axis: $(x, y) \rightarrow (x, -y)$. So $(3, 5) \rightarrow (3, -5)$.

questions.question: What is $2 \times \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix}$?
questions.explanation: Multiply each component by the scalar: $2 \times 3 = 6$ and $2 \times (-4) = -8$. Result: $\begin{pmatrix} 6 \\ -8 \end{pmatrix}$.

questions.question: Find the magnitude of the vector $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix}$.
A point $(2, 7)$ is rotated $180°$ about the origin. What are the new coordinates? Write as (x, y).
questions.explanation: Rotation $180°$ about the origin: $(x, y) \rightarrow (-x, -y)$. So $(2, 7) \rightarrow (-2, -7)$.

questions.question: Two angles at the circumference subtended by the same arc are $x°$ and $48°$. Find $x$.
questions.explanation: Angles in the same segment (subtended by the same arc at the circumference) are equal. So $x = 48°$.

questions.question: A triangle is dilated by scale factor 3 from the origin. If vertex $A$ is at $(2, 5)$, what are the coordinates of $A'$? Write as (x, y).
questions.explanation: Dilation by factor 3 from the origin: $(x, y) \rightarrow (3x, 3y) = (6, 15)$.
